reviews.title: Don't slide down but‚Ä¶see comnent
reviews.review_text: Theseccurtain rods stay up tho my curtains aren't too heavy (blackout). Unlike some of better quality, (not twist but adjust w a screw) you have to readjust every single time by twisting when you put them back up. Depends on what you need them for. Work for me! Bargain!

reviews.title: it works that's all that matters
reviews.review_text: used two per level in an unused doorway to make a shelf to display action figures Barbies and other toys my children wanted to keep. first did with the smaller version to make shelves in a awkward space between a bricked over chimney and the wall a shelf to display Barbies and other collectibles.

reviews.title: tension rod for curtains
reviews.review_text: I used this tension rod in a small bathroom window and it fit price was right and the quality was excellent. I would definitely recommend this product.
Used to separate area in closet for shoes and boots. Used shelves and drilled holes and stacked on top so I would have more than one shelf. Works great, nice and sturdy.

reviews.title: Real good basic springrod
reviews.review_text: Great basic springrod for light curtains. I sewed three sets of cotton curtains for the small windows in my granny pod; these rods hold them on the windows beautifully. No need to remove blinds if you're a renter, the rods are thin enough to place just below the top of the blinds. If you tie back your curtains daily, make sure that your rods are holding tightly enough. Not recommended for heavy fabrics such as brocades, jacquards, and other common curtain fabrics except for very narrow windows.

reviews.title: Durable and strong
reviews.review_text: I use spring rods to hold window quilts in place to insulate from heat and cold. While the quilts are not heavy (polyester batting between cotton flannel), pulling them aside during the day takes its toll. The heavy rods are far more durable, bend less, and are more comfortable to set in place than the thinner rods.

reviews.title: Worth the money
reviews.review_text: dont go with the skinny white ones; they bend way too easily. these silver rods are a little bigger diameter, so are more sturdy %26 worth the money. the silver didnt show thru my white valances either. i've bought 4 of them now.

This item was not delivered with the other items. Driver told me it was not put in her delivery van and I needed to call Walmart cs 1800 to report item. Ever received. I received the curtain rod today and appreciate quick response to undelivered item. I have used these suspension rods for decades and glad they are still available.
It can't handle any sort of weight and broke in the first 24 hours and I had to buy a new one somewhere else

reviews.title: Walmart's website needs serious work...
reviews.review_text: Was searching for 'SHOWER curtain rods' and bought this by accident because Walmart's search engine is trash. Now I'm out $7 because Walmart is more interested in selling you their garbage than actually helping.

Good value for the money. Adjusts well and is ok in place. It is WAY thinner and lighter duty than I had hoped thought. It is more like one of those very light duty curtain rods for a window valance or liner. If you have a light shower curtain it works, but don't put any pressure on it. Again though, great value for the price.

reviews.title: Perfect for my project
reviews.review_text: This is exactly what I wanted for my project, and I was so happy to find it! I put up curtains in an opening with a half wall to hide a messy room and separate it from the neat and tidy rooms. Very easy to install and holds up well so far! A little thin but was delivered with no dents.

reviews.title: Lite Curtain Rod
reviews.review_text: This works if you have window casing to place it in. I have two others that I bought almost 20 years ago from Walmart, I am sad to say that I do not think these will last as long but I only needed them for my lite weight curtains and they do the job quite well. Just be aware they are cheaply made and if you are using anything but cotton be extra careful putting your curtains on as they may snag the material.

reviews.title: Walmart good; product 75%.
reviews.review_text: I planned to use these as separator segments on a top shelf. The idea works; however one of the 4 tension rods I ordered did not work. There was no spring in it, and I will have to figure out how to go to a Walmart store to obtain a refund. Otherwise, the service was great from Walmart; all was delivered on time and intact.

reviews.title: Simple Curtain Rods
reviews.review_text: Chrome finish is smooth w/o blemishes, spring is stout enough to withstand 3 sets of not-flimsy-material curtains w/chrome-finished gromets across 62" window, and the 5/8" diameter fits the gromets w/no hassle. I despaired of finding a rod w/this length, a strong adjustment action and a smaller than 1" diameter so am very pleased w/this purchase.

reviews.title: It works, but it's frustrating
reviews.review_text: The difference in the two sizes of the pole make it impossible to slide the curtain open/closed smoothly, it hangs up on the transition. I did put some duct tape around it solve that problem but that does look a bit unsightly. It does the job, but it's cheap and frustrating

reviews.title: Great Product!
reviews.review_text: These worked perfectly I am not using them as tension rods but as normal curtain rods. I needed a specific size rod for my self adhesive brackets and these worked perfectly. Plus I needed several so very affordable I was not going to pay $20 per rod when I needed so many!

reviews.title: Good buy but I don't recommend delivery
reviews.review_text: This rod is fine but it is bent at one end, during delivery I assume. It still works by hanging up my 2 beaded curtains. It's very reasonably priced and easy to use. I'm satisfied other than the cosmetic damage. It's covered up by the curtain so it's not noticeable.
The only thing I don't like is the sticker on it that tells you how to adjust it. It works beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è
It was absolutely perfect. I needed a tension rod with low circumstance that is what I got. very happy with the results!!
Substitutions was made with incorrect size. Ypu gave me a bigger item than I asked for. Then I had to return the next day. At least substitution is size requested.
Dogs destroy blinds. Decided to use the spring rods for the inside of the window with semi shear drapes instead. Dogs have pretty much stayed out of the windows since I changed. Go figure.

reviews.title: Dont waste your money
reviews.review_text: trash! should have gone with the 3$ option. though this would be better as the rod was larger. nope. plastic non gripping end caps and the tubing to make a "rod" has a gap in it, to the entire length of the rod is a 1mm gap
This curtain rod allows you to hang curtains and not poke holes in your walls. I'm absolutely thrilled with his performance and then I'm not having holes in my walls and curtains hung up.

reviews.title: Curtain pole
reviews.review_text: I order this yesterday come to find out the one side of the pole is bend and is not what I was expecting

reviews.title: Great curtain rod!
reviews.review_text: This was a perfect, inexpensive way to hang up my kitchen curtains. I am grateful it was this easy!

reviews.title: No quality
reviews.review_text: Sorry about the more expensive rod and it's just as flimsy and cheap as the cheaper rod and this one came broken
unfortunately I wanted to use it in a closet and its kinda flimsy. not even sure it's strong enough for a curtain. ü´§
No problems hanging it up and it hasnt come down so im totally ok with this product. Again, great buy

reviews.title: cheap
reviews.review_text: Very cheaply made. If you not careful you can slice your finger open on it. I dont think it would hold up to heavy curtians

reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
reviews.review_text: Definitely not heavy duty. Wouldn't hold a heavy curtain. But does well with the set I bought to cover closet space. So sheer curtains, balance, anything of lighter material.

reviews.title: Poor Quality all around
reviews.review_text: I have purchased several twnsion rods over the years, and this one has to be the worst. The spring wouldn't hold tension and the metal was super thing to the point that it would probably only hold sheers. Very poorly manufactured.

reviews.title: Holds 4 x 84" curtain panels with ease!
reviews.review_text: The size fits my 55-in window without any problem. I have 4 x 84-in panels, and the full weight of the curtains do not negatively impact the tension of the rod either.

reviews.title: Disappointed- Arrived broken
reviews.review_text: One of my two tension rods arrived with a broken spring inside. It is too much of a hassle to return as I don't live near a Walmart or have the original box.

reviews.title: Decent.
reviews.review_text: These rods are OK. They do the job but aren't the best I've ever seen. I said yes to recommending because they do seem to work. But as I said, they aren't the best quality of all of the rods I have purchased.

I was told to buy these rods for my windows as you go to put them up for them to stick on the windows. They pop right off so I had to come up with an ingenious way using them since I already bought them and I bought some command strip hooks that would fit and stuck them up on the wall. The only thing is I had to get double stick tape to go inside the hook so they won't fall out because they don't have fat. What do they call the ends Finals? Ok.

reviews.title: Holds really well and doesn't slip or fall
reviews.review_text: I got these to put sheer curtains on my windows. I got one to make sure it would do the job as the ones I had before kept falling. They're so easy to install and adjust really well to whatever size you want. the ends are of nice rubber that helps it hold and doesn't retract back. I world-changing put heavy stuff on them. I put sheer light curtains and holds really well. Not sure it would hold heavier curtains as well. It's a great price and good enough quality to get the job done.

reviews.title: curtain rods
reviews.review_text: I NEED TO RETURN TWO OF THE I NEED ONE IN A SMALLER SIZE PLEASE
Solid %26 Tight %26 good equality tension rod. not too heavy.
does what needed, quality, affordable, delivery quick too.
Have not used yet, but item seems to be as descri bed.
Very sturdy and a good mid sized width. Holds the small curtain I have very well
Arrived in perfect condition. Use it in the hallway to curtain off an area. Easily adjusts.

reviews.title: Great price tension curtain rod.
reviews.review_text: Perfect tension rod for what I needed. I might have to get another one.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.review_text: The curtain rods seem to get the job done and work just fine and shipping was excellent and fast!!

reviews.title: didn't work for my window
reviews.review_text: It's to small for the windows and I would like to get a refund for this
It was what I expected. It fit perfectly. It solved my problem. It was inexpensive.

reviews.title: Lid hangar
reviews.review_text: I used this adjustable shower rod in my pantry, from side to side, close up to one of my bottom shelves, or maybe you could run it from a shelf to the door frame, but close enough to hang my pot lids, using the top of the lid to hold them on the rod.

reviews.title: Kind of flimsy- I had to get creative
reviews.review_text: I made this work. I used this in a 71‚Äù span and did have to make a mid-section support. As well, I added support at the ends because they have a tendency to slip. So, I sliced a 1/2‚Äù section of a pool noodle, then cut that in half to create 2 semi-circles. I screwed those into the wall to create a ‚Äòledge‚Äô support and now it works fine. But for the price, I can‚Äôt complain- just have to get creative.

reviews.title: Flimsy Rod
reviews.review_text: Sorry, but this rod is too flimsy for holding my curtains it droops in the middle.

reviews.title: Not good for anything heavy.
reviews.review_text: Pretty flimsy but if you are only using it for light curtains it will be okay.
There was a lower priced option but it wasn't available. Overall I'm still satisfied with the purchase. I'm only using the rods temporarily anyway.

reviews.title: Material durable, price ok
reviews.review_text: Length/size was perfect for a DIY decoration job that I wanted to add for Christmas. I will be able to reuse in future also.

reviews.title: Very sturdy strong
reviews.review_text: I need to adjust it a bit for where I it squeeze between but Perfect strong sturdy will last for many years
Nice looking , I was hoping it would be a little stronger, but it will work just fine.the price was great.

reviews.title: Well worth it
reviews.review_text: Well worth the price - even though it IS NOT expensive.
rubber tips fit perfectly in window mainstyle curtain rod
I did not receive this item...I would like it delivered or a delivery credit thank u

reviews.title: Not strong enough for curtains.
reviews.review_text: it is not strong enough to hold anything.
Wasn't very stable and couldn't take much weight, only light fabric.

reviews.title: Spring rod
reviews.review_text: Works great. Inexpensive yet very sturdy

reviews.title: Don't recommend.
reviews.review_text: Seam is bent and tension spring does not work .

reviews.title: Lasted zero showers.
reviews.review_text: Hard to get it to expand. It went up finally but came sailing back down once it had a curtain on it.
it arrived looking good but when i extended it and hung it up it came down. probably a problem with the spring

reviews.title: tension curtain rod
reviews.review_text: can be used to hang curtains in the window when your landlord doesn't allow you to put holes in the wall to hang curtains the conventional way
Very flimsy and weak...only use if you have a very light weight curtain that will not be frequently moved.

reviews.title: TensionLESS
reviews.review_text: Terrible condition when received the item, the tension wouldn‚Äôt even hold. Which put a longer wait on our remodeling....
The rods are skinnier than I thought they would be, and seem kind of flimsy - However, they work for what I needed them for!

reviews.title: As advertised
reviews.review_text: Rod was exactly as advertised. Used to hang sheers across the laundry area which measures about 60"

reviews.title: Tension rod
reviews.review_text: The tension rod was inexpensive but does the job. It didn't break when it was pulled also it stayed in place.
These were a perfect, inexpensive way to put up sheer curtains without having to mount any hardware.
I could not adjust firmly enough to stay up in my doorway, which is within range. I bought suoport holders to glue to door frame, which works.

reviews.title: Worked for me.
reviews.review_text: Just what I needed for my project. Price was good. The metal seems slightly thin but it does the job needed and the price was right.

reviews.title: Long %26 tall.
reviews.review_text: Walmart used to be open 24/7, here in the heights, wish they brought it back. Pickup is a pretty good deal, order anything.

reviews.title: Sturdy tension rod
reviews.review_text: I needed a longer tension rod for sheers and was hoping to find a much smaller diameter one, but once you get to a certain length this is as small a diameter as you can find. Since I could not get it in white, I just spray-painted it.

reviews.title: Think twice before you buy this
reviews.review_text: So this was supposed to be a basic replacement shower curtain rod I measured before I bought it. The bottom line is this keeps sliding off the tub enclosure I have picked it up so many times.

reviews.title: Irritated beyond belief!
reviews.review_text: I ordered 5 curtain rods for pickup. That was the total of my on-line order. I waited in my car for 1 hour, got home and realized they had only given me 4 curtain rods!!!!

reviews.title: Not worth buying
reviews.review_text: These worked fine for my smaller window but when you tried to get it to extend, it doesn't extend well and it hardly works to the 30 inches so I would not recommend this at all
I've been looking for curtain rods for a while and I was able to find them at Walmart.
it is sturdy and stays in place, and it is the right size .

reviews.title: Worth the price
reviews.review_text: They are sturdy. It worked for me perfectly.

reviews.title: Curtain rod
reviews.review_text: I'd buy again. Made very well and sturdy.

reviews.title: Rods
reviews.review_text: This rod was perfect for my daughters apartment so we didn't have to install any hardware!

reviews.title: Good sturdy rod that holds up insulated curtain.
reviews.review_text: Good sturdy rod that holds up insulated curtain.

reviews.title: Great Buy
reviews.review_text: I was looking for something to hang our room darkening curtains up since quarantine makes for the beautiful sunlight to be more noticeable in the morning. But didn't want to drill holes in the wall of the apartment. They would do for the price, plus its mainstays so I won't expect long use out of them but it does the job and fit perfectly with a nice tight hold for lite weight curtains

reviews.title: Pretty... much worthless.
reviews.review_text: It has jagged, sharp edge on the rod where the two pieces fit together, that quickly snagged my fingers. It is made of flimsy metal and was covered in white powdery, dusty substance inside the rod and on the plastic end caps. I wouldn't hang anything heavier than a body poof made of tulle, with a light weight hook. Very disappointed, since I had a difficult time trying to find a spring tension rod over 40" to begin with, this rod I thought was a stroke of luck, turned out to be a huge let down. I would not recommend, especially if you don't like getting cut.

reviews.title: perfect for curtains and other items
reviews.review_text: tension rods are a great way to hang curtains easily and quickly. they also make a fantastic way to display other hanging objects in you windows for different seasons. i used these to hang snowflakes in the windows in my classroom when suction cups would not stay stuck!
Bought two of them and both are weak or broken completely not recommended

reviews.title: Perfect tension rod!
reviews.review_text: Exactly what I hoped they'd be-will purchase again :)

reviews.title: Tension rods.
reviews.review_text: I am using the rods to support a gate to block cats from entering a room.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.review_text: Works great for hanging curtains. This was cheaper than buying a curtain rod.
it done the job to hang curtains but was bent on ends but its okay i used them anywayb
Curtain rod is adjustable and easily holds a small privacy curtain.

reviews.title: Very weak so to speak.
reviews.review_text: Very spindly and lightweight. Use this for sheers only. They won't hold much weight.

reviews.title: Hang that curtain

reviews.review_text: fits nicely and holds the weight of a very heavy sheet i am using as a curtain.

reviews.review_text: Was good quality and perfect for the purpose.

reviews.title: exactly what i wanted
reviews.review_text: i was looking for a thicker curtain rod to hang things on and this is perfect.

reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.review_text: This will not stay in the window without any weight at all. It just falls down after a few seconds.

reviews.title: Great size and works well on lightweight curtains.
reviews.review_text: Perfect size but rubber ends could use more grip when using a heavier curtain.

reviews.title: Cheap and simple
reviews.review_text: Not very strong but does and super simple job ok. Slightest tug on curtain with drop the rod and curtain into the floor

reviews.title: Short erm/ After 31/2 months.
reviews.review_text: Lasted me from Jan - April 2024. Good while works and break with the spring metal part coming out. I prepare myself to buy this every 3-6 months.

reviews.title: Tention Rod
reviews.review_text: The rubber on the ends are terrible, one of the poles the metal is not wrapped tight, the design does not allow you to get tention tight enough.

reviews.title: missing
reviews.review_text: its an okay bar but the end was missing the rubber so it slides on the hooks im using and i couldn't use it as tension rod it would mess up my paint

reviews.title: Very flimsy
reviews.review_text: The large rod was split about 3 inches where the other rod joins it. Had to duct tape it to hold it together

reviews.title: Nope
reviews.review_text: Had a crack when it arrived and just slid off the wall crashing to the floor causing the crack to deepen.

reviews.title: Damaged, Smashed Flat
reviews.review_text: Goods arrived damaged, smashed and crumpled on the end(s). This is inexcusable. DO NOT PURCHASE and have it shipped.

reviews.title: Not much tension in the rod
reviews.review_text: These adjust to the correct size, but when you go to put them in place they release the tension necessary to get them firmly in place and to hold curtains with a little weight. This is indeed a situation of getting what you paid for.

reviews.title: For who care for the price but not quality..
reviews.review_text: The material is thin and not fully closed. Be careful might cut your fingers. That is why the price is cheap. If you are not picky about material and quality then you may consider. Otherwise, NO!

reviews.title: Solid springs
reviews.review_text: I haven't had this long, but it's doing very well with good grippy ends and solid springs. I plan on getting more of these for other curtains and in the house.

reviews.title: Great product crappy service
reviews.review_text: Rod itself is fine but since there is not a spot to complain about service ill do it here. I received 2 rods and 1 is correct and the other is a different size and color. There was no explanation or anything that they were doing that and unfortunately i didnt notice until i got home. Really unhappy with Walmart.

reviews.title: Id pick a day im off or staff was present.. üôÑ
reviews.review_text: While I can't fault the driver, I picked a delivery day the lobby was closed.. Im sure someone in the building took one of the 48 inch rods..üòü aside from that I've just hung my curtains.. their working just fine.. The driver called me because he couldn't get in the building..We agreed on how he was going to make the delivery.. Not his fault..I grateful thay didn't take them all..oh well.. It's cool .

reviews.title: Great product, when U can't screw in a Rod.
reviews.review_text: I have a screen porch %26 you can't hang rods on the metal framed to add any valence, so I used these adjustable tension rods %26 was able to put a 12inch long valences in my screen room. It took seconds to twist to size of screen frame, slip the valence on %26 put securely in the metal frame. Big wind storm came %26 all my rods stayed in place !

reviews.title: Not Worth The Money
reviews.review_text: The spring loaded rods were purchased to hang sheers. The problem is there isn't enough tension to hold the rods firmly in place. If you try to tighten the rods, they snap back and fall. To securely hold the rods in place, you need to add brackets underneath the rods, which defeats the purpose for purchasing spring loaded rods. Look for a better quality product.

reviews.title: Very sturdy and great with my curtains
reviews.review_text: I purchased new curtains for my living and bed rooms and instead of the mis-matched rods of different colors and lengths I've collected over the years, I decided to buy all new rods. These are sturdy, strong, great adjustable length and very affordable which is why I bought five.

reviews.title: Bummer
reviews.review_text: I had this delivered and it's bent on one end. That's a bummer because I can't bring it back . I'm disabled and it's a lot of trouble finding someone to do tedious things like return a 5.00 rod it's still 5.00 out of my disability pay . If it had not been bent it probably would have been just fine. Nothing fancy but usable if not bent .

reviews.title: Sharp edges ruin curtains
reviews.review_text: Thicker than the other Walmart tension rods so it doesn't bend but my curtains have tears and snags from the super sharp edges. The curtains get stuck on the overlap between the two pieces every time because it's just sharp metal with nothing covering it. Certainly not worth the price.

reviews.title: Ehhhh
reviews.review_text: Was shorter than expected and the quality isn't what I thought

reviews.title: Not recommended.

Seems fine but the rubber tip ,,critical ...was off when product arrived

reviews.review_text: This does not lock in place so every time you remove it you have to resize it to fit. Its also very weak. Wouldn't hold my curtain. Ugh....

reviews.title: broken?
reviews.review_text: this curtain rod has a spring/coil inside as if it will adjust to fit, but the inner rod simply slides down over the spring rather than working as it should: screw/twist to extend using the spring as pressure to fit the space.

reviews.title: Works and looks good
reviews.review_text: Basic shower rod, thin and short for smaller stalls. Good tension system. Where the rods overlap there is a crease that catches the rings but I have it extended pretty far. I‚Äôm going to buy another

reviews.title: Perfect for basic window needs
reviews.review_text: Using it for a laundry window to hang a curtain to keep the direct sunlight out. Perfect for what I was needing it for. Nothing fancy and only for use with something lightweight.

reviews.title: Fail
reviews.review_text: I ordered 2 identical tension rods. They were not the same size. The one that worked was smaller than I ordered and wouldn't hold a light weight current. The one that was the correct size was broken.

reviews.title: Good for lightweight decorations
reviews.review_text: It is thin and I don‚Äôt think would hold much weight, but it is what I expected and perfect for my use. I bought it to hang lightweight decorations. The price is great for my use.

reviews.title: Does not work.
reviews.review_text: Although it's a tention rod, when compressed, the rod doesn't hold its length and shrinks. I had 2 of them and both behaved in the same manner. It's useless.

reviews.title: Does not last
reviews.review_text: Rod ended up buckling and is sagging in the middle. Not sure why this happened. I measured and hung up the rod without any issues. Now needs to be replaced and is barely hanging.

reviews.title: sturdy and they don't fall down.
reviews.review_text: I was honestly pleasantly surprised by these tension rods. They're strong and sturdy, they don't wobble, or sag in the middle, and they stay up and don't even move when I open the curtain every morning.

reviews.title: Affordable %26 Very easy to hang
reviews.review_text: Really practical for when you want to add a second set of curtains such as sheers. Needs no hardware, so perfect for renters or if you dontvwant to drill holes.

reviews.title: very unstable
reviews.review_text: very flimsey. wont even be able to touch the curtain without it falling. I f you make a 75" tension rod it should be a solid piece of metal, this one is not.

reviews.title: Wrong size!!!!
reviews.review_text: Very clearly ordered the one that extends to 48‚Äù, not starts at 48‚Äù!!!!!! I can not use this way too long curtain rod!!!!! I need credit!!! Why can't I ever get everything I ordered right????? Something is always missing or wrong!!!
Perfect economical solution for a window area that is divided into 3 equal sections. The slightly larger diameter rods stay put better than the skinny ones I have used in the past.

reviews.title: No tension
reviews.review_text: I needed some tension rods for a curtain sheers , they don't even lock in place , I tried everything, it didn't work , I am taking the two I bought back to the store.

reviews.title: Bought 3, one was damaged.
reviews.review_text: These adjustable tension rods are able to hold up lightweight sheers in windows, but I don't believe they would hold up much more weight than a couple of very sheer panels. The metal finish is smooth and the sheers slipped on very easily. You can take off the cap on the end making it simple to slip the curtain/sheers on. I bought three, and two worked great. One of them was damaged so I swapped it out for one that worked just fine. The end caps are smooth on the end, another reason they will not support a lot of weight is because there's no traction on the ends.

reviews.title: Heavy duty, good value
reviews.review_text: It's hard to find a tension rod longer than 48 in, that's not a shower rod. This rod and it's shorter counterpart are larger diameter than other tension rods I've purchased. I bought a skinner rod at a home improvement store and it bent while I was trying to position it between two walls, this rod is far sturdier. Time will tell if the rubber caps will hold up, but I'm hopeful. The one's i purchased in Walmart store clearly proclaimed "Made in USA" on the package, an added plus. The picture on here doesn't show the cavernous sharp seam and the edges are rough enough they grab whatever you try to slide over them, but I haven't seen a better alternative.

reviews.title: Tension Rod
reviews.review_text: This tension rod was so easy to use and install!

reviews.title: great
reviews.review_text: so easy to install. I am a fall risk and had no problem hanging my string curtain, YAY!!!!

reviews.title: Adjustable curtain rod
reviews.review_text: I think it is a little flimsy. However, you do get what you pay for and it certainly was not expensive. It does do the job I bought it for!

reviews.title: Curtain Rods
reviews.review_text: I'd received 6 of my curtain rods and 1 of them i did not get. When will i receive the one thats missing? id ordered 7 curtain rods
Did not work well for me. Will not stay in place when extended. Will not purchase again for anything sizable
The product was difficult to extend. You had to handle the product gentle so as not to bend the rod.

reviews.title: Flimsy curtain rod
reviews.review_text: You get what you pay for, I guess. It is adequate but next time I will get a better quality one. I do not recommend this one.

reviews.title: Doesn't work
reviews.review_text: I tried to use this to hold curtains over my child's closet. Any time I tried to extend it to fit the opening of the closet, the "tension" in the rod would just release and everything I had extended would go back to how it was originally. It wouldn't ever stay. I bought 2 of them just to make sure I didn't just get a broken one the first time. They both did the same thing.

reviews.title: Skip this one- poor quality and design.
reviews.review_text: Would never buy again. The design is horrible compared to the other black or white tension rods Walmart offers. The tubing is split by design and bends easily. Does not allow curtains to slide smoothly and the split looks terrible if it√¢¬Ä¬ôs not specifically rotated. One would not adjust because of the poor spring √¢¬Ä¬òcatch√¢¬Ä¬ô design and I had to pry it with pliers to get it to work. Feels more like a one dollar item.

reviews.title: Worked for what we needed!
reviews.review_text: We live in a very small apartment with lots of wasted vertical space in our closets top shelves. I had the idea to use two tension rods as a sort of shelf for bins holding some of our very light/ seasonal items to take advantage of the storage. These were easy to figure out. I bought them in store, so no damage. Of course, I wouldn't put a crazy amount of weight, but they did the job! Make sure you buy tension rods with a larger max range than you need and keep the tension as tight to the wall as possible and they work great! I will be soon ordering longer ones for our bedroom closet.

reviews.title: BEWARE THIS IS DANGEROUS!!!
reviews.review_text: If I could write a zero review I would!! These piles are flimsy and NOT a tube!!! NOT a sealed tube. It is just a piece of aluminum or what ever the material it is.. bent into a tube. not sealed. If you touch the edges, or slide your hand on the edge... YOU WILL CUT YOUR HAND!!! BEWARE OF THIS ITEM!!!

reviews.title: YOU'LL BRING THEM BACK. WHY BUY THEM AT ALL?
reviews.review_text: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE. The springs slip when compressed even an inch and a half. Hence, there is no way these could support anything other than sheer curtains. Bought 2 of them, both of them are total failures. Had to give at least 1 start to post this. NOT EVEN WORTH THAT!

reviews.title: unhappy customer
reviews.review_text: I've bought quite a few expandable curtain rods for my apartment and had good luck with them this one was a bigger size and cheaply made the spring was broke so now I have to take the bus and return it to Walmart since I don't drive what an inconvenience

reviews.title: Either defective, or terrible design.
reviews.review_text: I bought the Mainstays 48"-75" Adjustable 5/8" Diameter Chrome Finished Tension Curtain Rod to hang two curtains. That never happened, because the rods easily slide in and out without grabbing the spring. I can extend them to the desired width, but they collapse in with very little force. Not recommended.

reviews.title: Weak tension. Isolated defect?
reviews.review_text: This was a nice looking rod. It extended to the advertised length. However, it did not retain the tension and the curtain kept falling down. it was not a heavy curtain. Perhaps something internal was not fastened correctly. I had to return this. Walmart gladly accepted the return. I wish it would have worked.

These will not stay extended. Just as soon as you think you have them twisted out to the perfect length and go to install, they pop and slide back smaller. Time and time again this happened and with both that I bought - so it wasnt just a fluke. Dont waste your time - they won√¢¬Ä¬òt work for your project and you√¢¬Ä¬ôll have to figure out another method of installation- hopefully not at the very last minute before a party, like me!

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.review_text: Seemed nice enough for the price. I bought the wrong length, though, so I ended up returning. The return process was easy at the store.
HMM...quality is not good. It already had a crack. But it works. If you are looking for temporary rod, this is good option but if you wanna get solid one, i don't want to recommend this....
When I opened them up to nearly full length it was weak in the middle. Wish they matched more perfectly in the middle so I could move my curtain more easily along the rod

reviews.title: Tension Curtain Rod
reviews.review_text: Bought 4 of these for a project. Hung extra-lightweight Mainstays Value Shower Liners on them to cover some drafty doorways. Easy to use. Don't know how much weight they can take, but they worked for me.

reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
reviews.review_text: If you need something sturdy. This is not the one. I bought this to use on the garage to hang cleaning tools to dry once I sanitize them. Metal is cheap and thin.

reviews.title: Good Buy For the Price
reviews.review_text: These rods are a very good price for the money. One drawback is if you use them for medium to heavy curtains, they bow slightly in the middle. Need a middle curtain bracket.

reviews.title: Exactly as described
reviews.review_text: The tension rod is exactly as described. Works perfectly for light, short curtains. I have no complaints. The rod is thin and light, which again, is exactly what I wanted it for. That said, I would hesitate to put longer/heavier curtains on it.

reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.review_text: Despite mixed reviews I purchased this for two bathroom windows. It does not work properly. Tension is unsupported in one of the rods and is flimsy. Collapses when twisted to BBC a certain point. Not worth it despite the price.

reviews.title: EASY . . . my kind of projects!
